messages.title: A personal message from ROBERT GOODWILL
messages.content: Five years ago the people of Scarborough and Whitby supported me as we took some tough decisions to fix the mess left by Labour. We are now seeing the benefits here on the coast. Unemployment has fallen dramatically and local firms are upbeat about the future. It is only because we have a strong economy that we can have good schools and strong NHS. Whitby Hospital's future is now secure.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises improvements to A64, £27 million for the Scarborough Market Hall to create space for 30 new businesses, and mentions the Water Park and other exciting plans for the Futurist site as well as a new skills college. A hope we can add a multi-store cinema to this list.
We must continue to invest in the NHS and ensure A&E in Scarborough can meet demand.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour is plotting with the Scottish Nationalists

issues.economy: We are now seeing the benefits on the coast. Unemployment has fallen dramatically and local firms are upbeat about the future.
issues.health: We must continue to invest in the NHS and ensure A&E in Scarborough can meet demand.

housing.content: £27 million for the Scarborough Market Hall will create space for 30 new businesses.

leaflet.personalStatement: Robert is proud to have been entrusted to represent Scarborough and Whitby as your MP for the last 10 years.

politicalExperience.achievements: Brought EU funding to local projects, improved education and tourism, introduced new tough drug driving laws and roadside 'drugalyzer' testing, architect of the HGV levy.

contactInformation.address: 9 Hanover Road, Scarborough, North Yorkshire, YO11 1LS

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes competitive claims of 'Competent leadership' versus 'Coalition of chaos', implying a strategic voting consideration.
